channel.title: Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Mac's Carnival
item.description: Fur Trade Days is excited to partner with Mac’s Carnival again for 2022!

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Fur Trade Days is excited to bring you great entertainment downtown on Friday and Saturday nights!

item.title: Fireworks
item.description: Fur Trade Days' 2022 Fireworks is tentatively planned for 10 p.m. Friday night.

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: The Chadron Fur Trade Days Traders' Market features merchants from around the area and across the country, and provides something for everyone. The 46th annual attraction is planned to remain at the crowd-favorite Dawes County Courthouse Lawn and boasts a slate of new merchants as well as familiar favorites!

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 46th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 9 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: Family-friendly fun begins Friday at the Dawes County Court House Gazebo.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Association’s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 7, for camp setup.

item.title: Forms
item.description: Entry forms, event signups, and posters will appear here.

item.title: Reunions
item.description: ​To list your reunion information, email info@furtradedays.com.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Updated June 7, 2022 — Event times are tentative and subject to change Thursday, July 7, 2022 All Day - Buckskinners primitive camp, open to visitors (3 Miles East, ~8 miles south from Museum of the Fur Trade) 10:30 a.m. - Story Time, Crafts, bread and jerky, and a movie (ages 3-9) (Chadron Public Library, Fifth & Bordeaux) 6-9 p.m. - Bands on Bordeaux - TBD (First Street, between Main & Bordeaux streets)

item.title: Museum of The Fur Trade
item.description: The Museum of the Fur Trade is located on the James Bordeaux trading post, which has become an important historical site over the years. The trading post was established in the fall of 1837 as a site for the American Fur Company to conduct business with American Indians who spent their winters in the area. Traders, Trappers, and Indians The Museum of the Fur Trade is dedicated to preserving the rich history of the North American fur trade.

item.title: Our History
item.description: Northwest Nebraska The Community of Chadron and all of Northwest Nebraska welcomes you to the unforgettably unique celebration of Fur Trade Days. Chadron, located in the northwest corner of Nebraska, was named for the French fur trader Louis Baptiste Chartran. This event offers a weekend filled with history, rendezvous, entertainment, down-home hospitality, great food, and lots of fun! There is something for everyone and a chance to see neighbors and make new friends.
